description: This Hertfordshire based village is located just south of Ware, near to the River Lee. This walk from the village takes you along a section of the Lea Valley Walk to visit the lovely Rye Meads Nature Reserve. On the way you will visit Stanstead Lock and pass neighbouring St Margarets. The reserve has some nice footpaths with lots of wildlife to see. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Stanstead Abbotts. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Built in 1538 the historic Red Lion pub is one of the oldest buildings in the area and the second oldest in Stanstead Abbotts. It started life as a monastery, then a coaching inn and was renovated in 2005 to help reinstate the character of the pub. They serve good quality food and gave a garden area. You can find them on the High Street at postcode SG12 8AA. The pub is dog friendly.

display_address: Millers Lane, Stanstead Abbots, Stanstead St Margarets, East Hertfordshire, Hertfordshire, England, SG12 8AF, United Kingdom
